news_items.content: Here's the rewritten list of news articles:
The Pollachi case has been reopened and four members of a gang responsible for raping eight women have been arrested. Additionally, 19-year-old woman was filmed in a car by the perpetrators.
R. Jayasri has been admitted to B. Com (General) with a scholarship at Chennai school.
Three students from Chennai College drowned in the Coimbatore River, and one kilogram of cocaine worth Rs 6 crore was seized in Chennai.
The Madras High Court judges who made surprise appointments have now withdrawn their recommendations for appointment.
A strong dust storm hit Delhi and adjoining areas, with an IMD red alert issued. TN minister K N Nehru's MP son and brother were involved in diverting funds from a bank loan of â‚¹30 crore.
An investigation into the death of a truck driver who killed a police officer while running over him at a traffic block on the Pune-Mumbai Highway has been postponed.
The third meeting of the India-Pakistan UN Security Council panel is set to take place.
Scientists have made progress in developing 2D metals that could be used for future technologies, but some experts warn that these materials are "cancerous and dangerous".
Sean 'Diddy' Combs has faced serious allegations related to rape and abuse. A witness came forward to testify about the alleged incidents.
AI technology is advancing rapidly, with a new funding round worth $14 billion. Apple is also developing custom chips for smart glasses.
The police in Saudi Arabia have used AI to help catch stalkers. AI tools are being used to sift public views on botox and fillers.
Microsoft has cut off access to Bing Search Data, shifting its focus to chatbots like ChatGPT and Bard.
A startup called Harvey AI has partnered with an existing legal firm to raise funding at a $5 billion valuation.
